solution_line_template: First find the amount of time it takes Marcus to saute the garlic and peppers: {saute_onions_time} minutes / {quarter_divisor} = <<{saute_onions_time}/{quarter_divisor}={saute_garlic_peppers_time}>>{saute_garlic_peppers_time} minutes
Then find the dough's resting time: {knead_dough_time} minutes * {twice_multiplier} = <<{knead_dough_time}*{twice_multiplier}={dough_rest_time}>>{dough_rest_time} minutes

Then add the kneading and resting time to find the total dough time: {dough_rest_time} minutes + {knead_dough_time} minutes = <<{dough_rest_time}+{knead_dough_time}={total_dough_time}>>{total_dough_time} minutes

Then multiply that amount by 1/10th to find the assembly time: {total_dough_time} minutes / {tenth_divisor} = <<{total_dough_time}/{tenth_divisor}={assemble_calzones_time}>>{assemble_calzones_time} minutes

Then add the saute time, knead time, rest time and assembly time to find the total time Marcus spends on the calzones: {assemble_calzones_time} minutes + {saute_onions_time} minutes + {saute_garlic_peppers_time} minutes + {dough_rest_time} minutes + {knead_dough_time} minutes = <<{assemble_calzones_time}+{saute_onions_time}+{saute_garlic_peppers_time}+{dough_rest_time}+{knead_dough_time}={total_time}>>{total_time} minutes
